definition: to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: The next day the hunter lured the quails with his quail call as usual.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，猎人照常利用叫声来引诱鹌鹑。

sentences.english: They were enticed westward by dreams of gold.
sentences.chinese: 他们被黄金梦引诱到西部。

sentences.english: Do not lure her away from her duty .
Some girls are coaxed into it by boy friends, or lure into it by predators.
sentences.chinese: 有些女孩这么做或受男朋友哄骗，或受猎艳者引诱。

sentences.english: It is a wonder how any man of feeling could have resisted the invitation.
sentences.chinese: 真不明白一个感情丰富的人怎么能挡得住这样引诱。

sentences.english: His friend tempted him into wrongdoings.
Apple had been setting the terms of the battle, baiting Google into action.
sentences.chinese: 苹果公司一直在为战争设置条件，并引诱谷歌参战。

sentences.english: Maybe we can lure them out. You know any bird calls?
sentences.chinese: 也许能引诱他们出来，你知道鸟怎么叫吗？

sentences.english: He succeeded in decoying the ducks toward his blind [hide].
sentences.chinese: 他成功地把野鸭引诱到他的隐藏处。

sentences.english: The frozen Dark Jedi lured Aayla to his tomb, and had her deactivate the stasis shield.
sentences.chinese: 被冰冻的黑暗绝地引诱她进入坟墓，打开了封印罩。

sentences.english: The fox ran out of his hole.
The swindler allured her by hopes.
These things have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you.
sentences.chinese: 我将这些话写给你们，是指着那引诱你们的人说的。

sentences.english: Nothing could tempt her to evil.
sentences.chinese: 什么也不能引诱她做坏事。

sentences.english: Maybe I’ll be tempted by the hot sizzle of hot dogs being sold around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 也许我会被那个角落烤热狗发出的嘶嘶声引诱过去。

sentences.english: Jeroboam enticed Israel away from following the Lord and caused them to commit a great sin.
sentences.chinese: 耶罗波安引诱以色列人不随从耶和华，陷在大罪里。

definition: to lure into/to entrap/to trick into/to entice/to induce/to invite/to tempt
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
to use gain as a lure
to induce/to encourage/to provide guidance/(medicine, chemistry) induction
